attributes.action: Ban the use of fireworks in residential areas except on agreed dates.
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair on animals, babies & young children who are frightened to death when fireworks are set off without warning in residential areas. The use of fireworks should only be allowed on 'special occasions' agreed, or at organized events, so the general public know when to expect fireworks going off, rather than them being set off on any night throughout the year unexpectedly. The pandemic has made this issue worse, with families and friends currently only allowed to meet in gardens.
attributes.background: Ban the use of fireworks at home & in residential areas, except on Bonfire night & confirmed dates throughout the year, or at organized events.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Only allow the use of Fireworks in residential areas by the public on 5 November: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556346

Make it illegal for fireworks to be set off on days other than Nov 5 and Dec 31: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559397

Introduce a Fireworks Permission Scheme: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569313
